name: Lemon Pancakes
instructions: Mix dry ingredients in a bowl.
Whisk milk, egg, melted butter, lemon juice and zest in another bowl.
Fold wet into dry until just combined; do not overmix.
Heat a non-stick pan over medium heat and cook 2–3 minutes per side until golden.
Serve warm with syrup or lemon slices.
notes: Let the batter rest 10 minutes for fluffier pancakes.
Replace milk with buttermilk for extra tang.

name: Garlic Tomato Pasta
ingredients: Fresh basil and grated Parmesan to serve
instructions: Cook pasta according to package directions; reserve 1/2 cup cooking water.
Heat oil, sauté garlic until fragrant (do not burn).
Add crushed tomatoes and simmer 8–10 minutes; season to taste.
Toss pasta with sauce, adding reserved water to loosen if needed.
Serve topped with basil and Parmesan.
notes: Add a splash of cream for a richer sauce.
Finish cooking pasta in the sauce for better flavor absorption.

name: Avocado Toast with Cherry Tomatoes
instructions: Toast the bread to desired crispness.
Mash avocado with lemon juice, salt and pepper.
Spread avocado on toast and top with cherry tomatoes.
Drizzle a little olive oil and serve immediately.
notes: Add red pepper flakes or a poached egg for extra protein.
Use ripe but firm avocados for best texture.

name: Banana Bread (Quick Loaf)
instructions: Preheat oven to 175°C (350°F). Grease a loaf pan.
Mix mashed bananas with melted butter, sugar, egg and vanilla.
Stir in baking soda, salt, then flour until just combined.
Pour batter into pan and bake 50–60 minutes until a toothpick comes out clean.
Cool before slicing.
notes: Fold in chopped nuts or chocolate chips if desired.
Store wrapped at room temperature for 2-3 days.

name: Simple Tomato Soup
ingredients: Fresh basil or cream to serve (optional)
instructions: Heat oil in a pot and sauté onion until soft.
Add garlic and cook briefly.
Stir in crushed tomatoes and stock; bring to a simmer for 15–20 minutes.
Blend until smooth with an immersion blender or in batches.
Season and serve with basil or a swirl of cream.
notes: Add a pinch of sugar if tomatoes are too acidic.
Serve with grilled cheese or crusty bread.
